video.title: STUDY FINDS B VITAMINS DO NOT HELP PREVENT HEART ATTACKS OR STROKE
video.description: High levels of homocysteine in the blood have been associated with increased risk of coronary artery disease and stroke.  Researchers in Norway studied whether using B vitamins such as folic acid and B twelve to lower homocysteine levels could help prevent cardiovascular events in patients.  While homocysteine levels did improve, overall risk for patients did not.
